election_record.label: Connecticut 1819 Lieutenant Governor

overview.note: The summary of the Original Election Returns reverses the totals in Hartford County for Jonathan W. Edwards and Stephen Walkley. The summary lists 2 votes for Edwards in Hartford and four votes total while listing 1 vote for Walkley in Hartford and 1 vote total.

sub_unit.name: New Fairfield
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in New Fairfield.

sub_unit.name: Newtown
sub_unit.note: Nathaniel Smith received 3 votes as Nathan Smith.

sub_unit.name: Hartford
sub_unit.note: The vote for James Hillhouse in Hartford County was not included in the summary sheet of the Original Election Returns.

sub_unit.name: Torrington
sub_unit.note: William Stone received 2 votes as William Lat Stone.

sub_unit.name: Wolcott
sub_unit.note: William Stone received 1 vote as William Lat Stone.

sub_unit.name: Vernon
sub_unit.note: Nathaniel Smith received 6 votes as Nathan Smith.

election_record.reference: Original Election Returns. State Archives, Connecticut State Library, Hartford.
Connecticut Herald, and General Advertiser (New Haven, CT). May 4, 1819.
The Republican Advocate (New London, CT). May 5, 1819.
